intro: Verbesina coahuilensis, commonly known as the Coahuila goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy yellow blooms. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, semi-desert environments. Its leaves are alternate and often have a rough, hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Verbesina coahuilensis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest for its ecological resilience in arid landscapes.
